title: Font Advice
content:
Im looking for a mature sophisticated font that will look well with the font felt tip, It is for a overhead fascia sign for a corporate level hot dog unit. Thank you for your help, all advice welcome:o)

 [‹ Logo with cooper black](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122044335/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47718 "Go to previous forum topic") ["The Sans" Condensed ? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122044335/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47695 "Go to next forum topic")
author: amyloo

comments.content: I’m not sure what you mean by a mature sophisticated font? As in straightforward, sturdy?
How about the priceless description in the Font Bureau catalogue, where one of its grotesques is called ’manly’ ?
Mrs Eaves from Emigre? Especially the Petite Caps are só sophisticated – in a feminine way that is.

What’s a “corporate level hot dog unit”?  
Is this for an identity to be used in a corporate environment/business-to-business communications, rather than consumer marketing?
